Statutory Notifications (S. R. 0.) 
GOVERNMENT OF PAKISTAN 
MINISTRY OF LAW, JUSTICE AND PARLIAMENTARY AFFAIRS 
NOTIFICATION 
Islamabad, the 17th February, 2012 
S. R. 0. 166(1)/2012.- In exercise of the powers conferred by Article 
100 of the Constitution of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, the President is pleased 
to direct that the following amendment shall be made in the Attorney-General for 
Pakistan (Terms and Conditions) Rules, 2011 and shall be deemed to have been so 
made on and from the 1st day of July, 2011, riamely:— 
In the aforesaid Rules, for Rule 2, the following shall be substituted, 
namely:— 
"2. Retainership, perks and privileges, etc.—(1) An 
Attorney-General for Pakistan shall be entitled to such salary, superior 
judicial allowance, house rent allowance and petrol for use of official 
car as are admissible to a Judge of the Supreme Court. 
(433) 
[2192(2012)/Ex. Gaz.] 	 Price : Rs. 2.00 
434 	THE GAZETTE  OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA, FEBRUARY 21, 2012  [PART II 
(2) 	Where the Attorney-General is required, otherwise than under rule 4, 
to leave the Capital in the performance of his official duties, such 
traveling and other allowances as are admissible to a Judge of the 
Supreme Court on tour shall be paid to him for the journey necessarily 
performed in the course of those duties." 
[No .F. 6 (2)/2010-A. VI.1 
SYED SULTAN AHMED, 
Sr. Joint Secretary.
